paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses sex-specific susceptibility loci associated with coronary artery aneurysms in Kawasaki disease patients. It mentions the KCNH2 gene in relation to a risk allele but does not provide specific variant details or penetrance data for KCNH2.

functional_data.summary: The T risk allele rs4725982 in the KCNH2 gene was associated with CAA formation in KD patients, but significance did not reach the Bonferroni corrected threshold.

variants.additional_notes: The association of the KCNH2 gene with CAA formation is mentioned in the context of its proximity to the NOS3 gene.
key_quotes: Furthermore, the T risk allele rs4725982 in the KCNH2 gene was found to be significantly associated with CAA formation in patients with KD (OR, 2.77; p=0.0042; Supplementary Table 2), although the level of significance did not reach the Bonferroni corrected significance threshold (p<0.0038 in the combined analysis).

tables_processed.table_caption: List of SNPs associated with CAA formation in KD patients

challenges: The paper did not provide detailed variant information or penetrance data for KCNH2.
extraction_metadata.notes: The KCNH2 gene was mentioned in relation to a risk allele, but no specific variant details were provided.
